    Simulate external exposure

    simulate_exposure.Rd

    Simulate external exposure

    Usage

    simulate_exposure(
  x,
  expos_mean = "mean",
  expos_sd = "sd",
  expos_label = "casn",
  n = 1000
)

    Arguments

    x

    data frame or list of data frames.

    expos_mean

    column name of mean values.

    expos_sd

    column name of standard deviations.

    expos_label

    column name of labeling term, required if x has more than one row.

    n

    simulated sample size.

    Value

    A list of matrices containing inhalation rates. Matrix columns are named using the values in the expos_label column for more than one data frame row.

    Examples

    data <- split(geo_tox_data$exposure, ~FIPS)

# Single data frame
simulate_exposure(data[[1]], n = 5)
#> [[1]]
#>         1582-09-8      51-28-5 510-15-6 72-43-5 76-44-8      77-47-4
#> [1,] 1.090811e-04 5.848432e-08        0       0       0 1.056507e-10
#> [2,] 8.750059e-05 6.770802e-08        0       0       0 4.588745e-10
#> [3,] 1.162021e-04 9.743651e-09        0       0       0 5.598812e-10
#> [4,] 1.243120e-04 7.274260e-08        0       0       0 2.099088e-10
#> [5,] 8.203307e-05 3.381474e-08        0       0       0 5.183190e-10
#>           87-86-5 95-95-4
#> [1,] 1.323982e-08       0
#> [2,] 1.284609e-08       0
#> [3,] 1.577227e-08       0
#> [4,] 6.605943e-09       0
#> [5,] 1.091679e-08       0
#> 

# List of data frames
simulate_exposure(data[1:3], n = 5)
